notes: Compact luxury sedan and coupe on GM Alpha platform competing with BMW 3-Series. ATS-V features twin-turbocharged V6 with 464 hp, available with 6-speed manual transmission. Production ended 2019. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac ATS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation mid-size luxury sedan on GM Alpha platform. CTS-V features supercharged LT4 V8 producing 640 hp, available with 6-speed manual transmission. Vsport trim offered twin-turbo V6. Supercharged variant requires performance-oriented service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac CTS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Full-size luxury sedan on Epsilon II LWB platform. Replaced DTS and STS models. Vsport trim featured twin-turbocharged V6 producing 410 hp. Production ended 2019. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac XTS article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 4.2L LTA twin-turbocharged V8 (500 hp, Platinum trim)
notes: Full-size luxury sedan on GM Omega platform. First Cadillac with Super Cruise semi-autonomous driving. 4.2L 'Blackwing' twin-turbo V8 exclusive to CT6, producing up to 550 hp in CT6-V. North American production ended February 2020 at Detroit/Hamtramck Assembly. Twin-turbo V8 requires specialized service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac CT6 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Mid-size luxury crossover SUV on GM C1XX platform. Replaced SRX. Features Active Fuel Management cylinder deactivation and automatic stop-start. AWD system includes twin-clutch differential with active torque vectoring and can disconnect rear drive unit for efficiency. 2010s portion only (2017-2019). Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac XT5 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Subcompact luxury crossover SUV on E2XX platform, slotting below XT5. Went on sale fall 2018 as 2019 model. 2010s portion only (first year). Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac XT4 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Fourth-generation full-size luxury SUV on GMT K2XX platform. Available in standard and ESV (extended) body styles. Transmission upgraded from 6-speed to 8-speed (2015-2017), then to 10-speed (2018-2020). Production ran January 2014 to December 2019. Hennessey HPE550 supercharger upgrade available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Cadillac Escalade article, December 19, 2024 revision.
